title: The Legend of Hercules
description: In Ancient Greece 1200 B.C., a queen succumbs to the lust of Zeus to bear a son promised to overthrow the tyrannical rule of the king and restore peace to a land in hardship. But this prince, Hercules, knows nothing of his real identity or his destiny. He desires only one thing: the love of Hebe, Princess of Crete, who has been promised to his own brother. When Hercules learns of his greater purpose, he must choose: to flee with his true love or to fulfill his destiny and become the true hero of his time. The story behind one of the greatest myths is revealed in this action-packed epic - a tale of love, sacrifice and the strength of the human spirit.

reviews.text: This movie is horrendous. The transitions are nonexistent. Hercules suddenly teleports from a boat to a desert and from a desert to a "fighting.....place?" The plot is basically nonexistent, the movie consists of Hercules going from bloodless battle to bloodless battle and doggy paddling across a shocking number of bodies of water(They could have at least got an actor who could swim) At the end of the movie Hebe, the generic love interest, stabs a dagger through her shoulder and into Hercules' brother, she somehow survives for long enough to say her final words, while the brother is dead instantly. Then suddenly the scene changes and you can hear a crying baby. The camera zooms in and Hebe is holding it. It literally never explained how this happened. NEVER! You can't just have somebody die and then show them alive in the next scene, that makes no sense! This movie is overall on atrocity. The only reason it got a one was one amusing scene where hercules got kicked in the face at a dramatic moment.
Terrible.  God awful--that's the phrase I kept repeating to myself while still in the theater, it was THAT bad.  No redeeming qualities whatsoever.  No one even looks attractive, it was that bad.

How could the same guy who directed Die hard 2 do something this terrible....this movie has no idea of what a movie is, everything was terrible, there was not one single thing I liked about this movie.

Wow, this movie is awful, I mean the CGI is the worse I have seen this year, (although I, Frankenstein might beat this movie), the acting is horrible, Kellan Lutz is so bland, he makes fellow Twilight star look like Marlon Brando in comparison, the love interest is just as bland, then the evil brother feels like a cheap knock-off of Commodus from Gladiator, in fact this movie is everything wrong with Gladiator, and 300 mashed-up together to make this piece of crap,( I would have used tons of other words by the way), then the action scenes have some of the worst slow-mo ever, I mean every fight scene,( If they couldn't be worse coming from that hack Renny Harlin), has this freaking obnoxious slow-mo, and coupled with horrible CGI.This movie is awful.
This is one of the worst movies I've seen. The CGI, acting, props, dialogue and scenes looks bad. the premise is alright. so that's why I'm giving it a 1/10 because it's not completely bad.

Wake me up please this is one of the most boring movies I've seen in a while.  I've seen some real awful films , but none as boring at meandering as this.  So since I couldn't stay awake and the fact that some looked like they tried hard in production it won't get a 0.  F
Don't spend your money to watch this movie! One of the worst movie recently. I could even guess every single plot while watching it! So boring so bad so damn bad...
Horrible movie with horrible plot, horrible acting, horrible special effects. One of the worst movies in recent memory, and maybe even ever. If you avoid seeing this film, feel proud of yourself.

The opening battle scene was pretty good, with the 3D effects creating an expansive battlefield. After that the movie went downhill quick. The forced romance scenes were numerous and unbearable. Once the characters actually had to speak dialogue it became even more painful. Also they must have run out of ideas with the Gladiator remake portion where they fight for their freedom. The guy who played Hercules has no acting skills and it shows. They just found some guy with a good body and handed him a script it seems. Just overall really poor. Also, the ending scene was incredibly stupid. It's as if the writers had to go on lunch break and just killed everyone bad in five seconds and then put in a dash of happy ending. Pathetic.

It contains nothing special. It's just a generic and slipshod movie. Terrible acting, effects and scenario. Boring, just boring as hell. Everything happens suddenly with no explanation. Do not watch it, it's just a waste of your money.

The Disney version of the Hercules Story, despite being a cartoon musical, was actually semi-enjoyable. this movie turned out to be a wanna-be CGI porno flick (i call it wanna-be cause the CGI effects were **** I wasted my time to even watch this, i hated this almost as much as i hated that God-awful "I Am Number Four" movie that my girlfriend made me watch. No depth, no value, terrible casting, absolute ****
It's not even about the true Hercules. I'm pretty sure they just put the name in so that people will think about the Greek Hero and flock to see the movie. Shameful.

Uuuugggghhhh this movie sucks. This movie makes Alien ressurection look like the lord of the rings trilogy. This movie is more like a terrible Gladiator remake. The effects are gabage. There was a scene in the movie where hercules was fighting a lion and the lion looked like a teddy bear. The acting sucked. One last thing: TOO MUCH SLOW MO. Final verdict is a 1/10 and its the aorst movie of 2014.

"The Legend of Hercules" 10 Scale Rating: 2.5 (Awful) ... The Good: While he didn't fit as Hercules, Kellan Lutz certainly looked at home in a gladiator style film. A few of the large scale battles were decent. The Bad: Poor acting and awful dialog all around. The story itself was bland and poorly written. The direction was choppy as the film moved from scene to scene suddenly and without warning. The effects were terrible and the vast majority of fight scenes were one part "300", two parts "Matrix". While I certainly would never expect award winning material here, this should have been at least fun. It wasn't.
Only slightly higher quality than a SyFy channel movie, The Legend of Hercules' production value makes it one of the worst action films I've seen in recent years.

The best bet is to hold out on this one—there will be another Hercules adaptation starring Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson hitting theaters this July. Stripped down to the basics, “The Legend of Hercules” does little to carry on the legacy of Hercules, proving only to be more of a sappy fairy tale than the Disney version.
Do yourself a favor, AVOID THIS AT ALL COST! It is absolutely an atrocity to cinema. Overall, just don't watch this!!!!!!!!!!! I give this garbage a solid F!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
For a movie called "The Legend of Hercules" there really isn't much to show for it. The story isn't that grand and exciting, and certainly bad acting and direction only make it worse.

Totally b-movie bad. Probably the worst thing about the movie is that it hard to support Kellan Lutz as Hercules. His performance is lacking, and constantly watching him make stupid faces during the action scenes is agonizing. Lutz isn't the only offender when it comes to bad acting, almost the entire cast sucks. Liam McIntyre gives the only respectable performance, and it's great to see the Spartacus star step back onto the arena sands. Shame about that bowl haircut though. While the performances range from lacking to just plain bad, the action is mostly decent. Granted there are countless movies that have done it better, and without constantly having characters goofily being thrown through the air in slow motion, but it's at least watchable. The action scenes are a constant form of unintentional comedic gold. One scene involving a lightning whip is particularly amusing. The action is the only enjoyable part of the film, but entirely for the wrong reasons. This is clearly just one huge b-movie. With Lutz failing to make a compelling Hercules in any way, the whole film noticeably suffers more than I feel it otherwise would have. Yes, it would have still suffered from the poor plot and bad acting from the rest of the cast, but had they at least found a half-decent person to play Hercules then maybe there would have at least been reason to overlook a lot of it's flaws and maybe even care about the romance at the center of this film. As it stands now I recommend you skip this one and hope that Dwayne Johnson's upcoming Hercules movie is better later this year. My total score for the film is a 4.2/10=Bad.

I don`t think it`s as bad as everybody is rating it. If you go into this looking for something special you will be let down, but it`s a fun movie at some points. I`m not a fan of the style this movie was done, but I thought it was worth watching.

The reviews on this movie baffle me. I'm not saying it was as good as Wolf of Wall Street but it was watchable. You guys are tough. I mean what it must take to make a movie is beyond me and I stand by my score of 7. This was not to bad...

This movie was average at best. the plot for the movie was ok but the movie seemed to jump from place to place with little to no explanation to what was going on. the acting wasn't bad and Liam McIntyre makes the acting good and the actor of Hercules wasn't bad either. it had some good action scenes in it but that's about it. overall was it a waste of time? no but i definitely would not recommend it.

this movie is way boring not even miley cryus would wanna bang or lick to see . not once did it have great violence .   take my advice do not take this movie is for professors to study greek . do not see this movie
The Way To Describe The Legend Of Hercules Is A Big Fat So-So The Sets Are Alright And Some The SFX Was Decent But Other Then That It's A Big So-So!!!

My God what did I just see. Do not watch this movie, please. It may make you feel bad for a couple of hours I could it believe so much that I had discovered this website with a Google search by asking for a movie review. So I created this account to tell you that this movie is so horrible that it made me discover and create a metacritic account.

I can't wait for the other Hercules movie coming out soon, but The Legend of Hercules is by far the worst movie of 2014. Unless it features a Game of Thrones star, I ain't going to pay $10 bucks to watch another Hercules rip-off. I've watched a lot of Hercules way back in the 90's including the Disney version and Hercules: The Legendary Journeys staring the great Kevin Sorbo. How many updated versions of Hercules will they last? I don't know but Hollywood should just keep the Hercules to rest already. The Legend of Hercules features a terrible action hero who really can't act as Hercules, an dimwitted script, funny CGI elements, bland source material, and sometimes even Renny Harlin's Cutthroat Island is still a flop, maybe this one could add to his list of bad movies. He's a great director but needs to bring back Geena Davis and finally make some action movies together. If anyone buying a copy of the movie, please seek therapy. Bottom line: Avoid! Nothing you're going to see here. I just hope that Brett Rattner should be just fine about the new Hercules movie cause I know The Rock is going to kick some ass. I wonder if it's way better than The Mummy Returns or The Scorpion King? Unless for the Razzies for next year, The Legend of Hercules should be able to get more nominations than any stinker on the planet.

I was a History major and as such I find these types of films difficult to watch. They are so inaccurate and give people the wrong perception of history, then again, The Legend of Hercules was directed by Renny Harlin, and he wouldn't put his name on any old thing. After praying to Zeus for guidance, Queen Alcmene (Roxanne McKee) is picked to carry the son of God. The King however knows that Hercules (Kellan Lutz) isn't his and commits an act of betrayal that separates Hercules from the woman he loves. When I think of the mighty Hercules, Kellan Lutz isn't the first name that comes to mind, but he does a pretty solid job with the role. The rest of the cast also performed equally well, and for once the cast wasn't the problem. A film like this has a story to tell and that story can't be told in an hour and half. I enjoyed the narrative, but the best parts of the film were so rushed, that I felt slighted. The whole Egyptian angle should have been a major theme, but it only lasts about ten minutes, and before you know it, Herc is fighting for his life is arenas around the world, scenes that were also rushed. The film is very straight forward and far too predictable for a story like this. There are Kings and Gods, legends from thousands of years ago, but no twists or turns? No surprises thrown in for dramatic effect at least? Overall, the film is somewhat entertaining and as I said the cast was good, but The Legend of Hercules flies by at the speed of light, which makes the film difficult to really get behind.

A horrendous silly disaster. The movie looks so cheap, I didn't know to either burst out in laughter or actually feel sorry for the people involved in this film. If this was suppose to be an epic well it sure was, an epic failure.

A singular curiosity about this possibly being the worst reviewed movie so far this year prompted me to find out for myself if this really is as bad as everyone is saying. The answer is actually no, it isn't. Having said that it is by no means a great film, but I personally found it more entertaining than say, the po faced 'The Book Thief' or the soon to be marvelled at, but less than marvelous 'Captain America'. It's true the dialogue is uninspired and we have seen all this done before so much better in films like 'Gladiator' and '300' which it is obviously trying to emulate. However, the story is ok if predictable and it doesn't really bore one. Technically the film is more lacking than some. The special effects have a cut price feel to them and the photography comes over as an unfortunate mish mash of styles. The lighting of some scenes resembles cosmetic or shampoo adverts in how they have been shot. Other scenes seem to imply that the weather was not working for the production as they have a washed out desaturated look. I don't think anyone can argue with the fact that Kellan Lutz was built for the part even if an Oscar will not be his any time soon. On the plus side both the music and sound are very good.

You know what, the movie's visual effects were better than its actors. The acceptable stunts and graphics for a B movie, but the let down came from the performances. I don't know what happened to the director, he used to make the better movies in his early career and now he lost his way. Maybe the big stars don't believe in him that may lead him to recruit second stream actors. The romance portions were too bad, no chemistry, physics, mathematics, nothing, but just an ordinary without the feelings. When it comes to the game of throne, that's looked okay as it scripted like 'snakes and ladders' game. Anyway, it was a well known story among most of us which was altered and told somewhat differently. Disappoint is there though still somehow watchable. Don't force yourself for this, because you are not going to miss any masterpiece. It's becoming a habit in Hollywood, like I already mentioned in a review a year ago that two same thematic movies coming out of a same period. So this time Dwayne Johnson's movie wins the race, according to the ratings and reviews across the internet, but I still have to see it first before compare them both.

Just think of all the people that could've been fed and clothed with the money used to make this movie. It's a waste of everything, I don't see how this didn't go into a vault never to be release. Thank God it's over for me.

After first 30 minutes I was going to give this movie 5 mark - average mix of The Gladiator and 300. But after each 10-20 minues my mark was going down - numerous plot holes are the case. I dont want to go ito details, there is just one thing I want to point out - when Hercules broke his stone pillars and started to swing with stones I thought - this is where fun must start, I thought I will see some blody bath like it was in 300. Another disappointment - not a sngle droplet of blood was spilled. Guys, they were hit by 200 lb stones, and not a single bone broken? Like wtf, is it a 10k budget movie? And in the end - princess got pierced through by sword survivied, while prince got pickled by sword died, lol. Awful.

Bland and boring to the point I can barely describe it. It was fun to make fun of it in the first fifteen minutes, but even that became boring. It's all sorts of stories we've already encountered in the past, wrapped together under the guise of Hercules, despite having little-or-nothing to do with the actual Hercules myth.The main lead has the charisma of a refrigerator, and looks like a quarterback that was accidentally cast by a movie studio. His love interest must have had about two hours of acting lessons, and family in the industry. The effects made action scenes look like video game cut-scenes.Only watch if you're in prison and they offer to reduce your sentence in return.
Dreadful acting, appalling special effects, cheap costumes and a completely scattershot plot, The Legend of Hercules is terrible in every possible way.
not worth the money you spend, just dont watch it. I litteraly was saying what the f@#k did I just watch once I was done watching....half way through the damn movie
And again the best Hercules movie that I ever seen is from Disney.Maybe Disney should do Hercules movie based on their animation or another animation "Frozen" style.

The Legend of Hercules is one of those films that got a January (2014) release and I was unable to catch it in the theater because I was busy screening Independent Spirit Award nominees as well as catching up with Oscar contenders.  Instead I rented it, and let me clearly state that I am happier to have spent 12 bits at Redbox than 12 dollars at the box office.

Wow... I'm so f*cking outraged right now. I have a new contender for the worst movie of the year, and it's The Legend of F*cking Hercules. Although "Transformers: Age of Exinction" gets an honorable mention, this one really takes the cake. Let me start by saying that Hercules himself is portrayed by a guy who doesn't know how to act and doesn't look handsome, at all. Seriously, he looks ugly. There's one scene where his love interest is dying and instead of... well, you know... performing, he just says a bundle of words and in the next scene, his girlfriend (I think) is suddenly ALIVE! HOW? HOW DID SHE GET BETTER? WHAT HAPPENED? DIDN'T SHE GET STABBED IN HER LEFT SHOULDER?????? AHHH WHATEVER!!! It's one problem that this movie has: The pacing. Holy sh*t, the pacing is f*cking horrendous. We jump from one scene to another without substance, feeling more like a marathon than a movie. The plot is convoluted at times, in fact, so convoluted that occasionally you don't know what the characters are talking about. Seriously, along with the bad pacing, we still have banal conversations between underdeveloped characters that are portrayed by untalented people, resulting in a dull movie that is 1 and a half hours (hey, at least, it's not as long as Transformers 4!). The action and the effects are reprehensibly bad. One thing I notice in the action sequences is that the director decided to put slow-motion in every single one of them, and I ask: What was the point? Why do you need to put slow-motion in your fight scenes? Hmm? For 3D? But, I'm watching this movie in my house, and I don't have 3D, so the fights don't come as exciting (because they are not). They come as moronic. Hey, I'm not gonna lie, I laughed at some parts. When the movie is not relying on unnecessary slow-motion, they resort to misguidedly choreographed battles. They are barely enthusiastic, if you ask me. It's a pity, because with all the swords, shields and equipment this movie had, it could've been a lot better. Like, A LOT. The cast looks bored. Kellan Lutz makes a terrible Hercules. I bet that Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson will make a better Hercules than him, and I haven't seen that movie yet! Luckily, for Lutz, he can't be blamed for torpedoing the project, as everything in this film is sub-par and so bland. The actress who plays the love interest of Lutz's character is just a bad actress. Hey, you girl, hear me out: Your bad performance in this hellish film was noticed by me! I saw how your character died, AND THAT WASN'T EVEN BELIEVABLE IN THE SLIGHTEST! URGH! Final Score to The Legend of Hercules: 0/10. Overall, avoid this clusterf*ck of a movie boasting a lackluster plot, generic characters, horrible pacing, uninspiring acting and laughably unexciting battle scenes. GOD, THIS MOVIE IS WORSE THAN TRANSFORMERS AGE OF EXTINCTION AND THAT'S SAYING SOMETHING BECAUSE THAT MOVIE WAS A FLAMING PILE OF SH*T. PLEASE, EVERYONE INVOLVED IN THIS STUPID MOVIE, GROW SOME F*CKING BRAIN CELLS!! Uff, Christ...

i'm proud of myself. I didn't see this movie more than 20 minutes.and i'm sorry directores, actors and writers related with this movie but the CGI suck, story suck and just Scott Adkins is badass so... this movie suck.sorry again...

Bad, best to wait till this is free on youtube to watch. Story is ridiculous and I love how they managed to hype this movie in the trailers. I saw the trailer and was like "sweet love a good Greek old school beating." Unfortunately there are terrible fight scenes that contain little to know actual blood and are not even entertaining. Only redeeming factor was they managed to get the actor who played "Spartacus" (TV series) a role in this movie. He was nothing special but at least reminded me how epic that TV series was.

Well the movie was ahhh not exactly what I expected.... Spoilers I thought that this movie will show the labors of the Hercules but they didn't show anything of this just a made movie by the scriptwriters.At the first it was ok but then with all this effects,slow motions and the other stuff I understand that the movie was not so good. Plot: 3/10Effects: 4/10Duration: 7/10

there is a scene in this "movie" where a women gets stabbed in the chest which is fine except you can see her tuck the sword under her arm also the camera is on the side that she does it even worse is when i walked into my local video store and had a look at the cover of this "movie" I laughed the reason i laughed is because the main characters head has been poorly photoshoped onto some guys body its all pixelated which lead me to believe they had about ten bucks left in the budget for the cover.also this wasn't just the one copy that was like this there was about six in the store

Vasat film. Hercules'ün adını ve hikayesini kullanıpta bu kadar kötü hatta dizi kalitesinde bile olmayan bir film çıkarmak ortaya ayrı bir başarı hikayesi olsa gerek. 300 Spartalı ve Spartacus tuttu diye onlara benzer olsun istemişler belli, hatta yetmemiş filmde Spartacus'ü de oynatmışlar ama onlarda olan tempo ve heyecan yok aslında kısaca hiçbirşey yok. Hercules'ün herkes tarafından bilinen hikayeleri bile adeta skeç gibi tek tek çekilmiş, olması lazım diye koymuşlar gibi.

The Legend of Hercules is the (slow motion) story of a twilight stuntman Kellan Lutz as Hercules,the son of Zeus.This movie contains just a bunch of slow motion scenes in EVERY SINGLE ACTION SCENE!Stupid non sense yelling,bad bad screenwriting,obnoxious acting and over the top conveniences!The Legend of Hercules is a truly truly awful movie!
Bad movie. Crazy overdose of slow motion!! Some of the fights could have been really cool, but permanent slow motion kind of ruined it for me. Bad actors.... boring most of the time

haha...hahaha...haha... HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHa HAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAhahahahahaha!HAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA! Oh my goodness! What did the people involved with this garbage think when they saw the final product? I mean....Cast an actor whose sole claim to fame prior to this was the Twilight movies?Write a poorly made carbon copy of Gladiator as the script?Use CGI effects that would have been decent at best in the late 90s?Have some of the most cliché and laughable dialogues possible? Man, that movie deserves all the flack it has received. This should've been a straight-to-DVD release.

1/5★Shades of 300 aside, the film is bad on so many levels, from the awful dialogue to the terrible acting by the entire cast.The action is a bright point, but if I wanted to watch men in costumes fight WWE is a better option: The acting is better and there are less cringe worthy moments.Kellan Lutz is a good looking guy. He's built like a Greek god. Both strong points. Acting, however, is his Achilles heel, which falls under the Situational irony category. Verdict: Watch Ben Hur. Watch 300. Skip this.
just crap that's all i'm saying this film is so badly put together and acted that it doesn't deserve better review if the filmmakers don't care why should I

So how was this? It’s literally one of the worst movies I have ever seen in my life. I hated everything about this movie. Nothing made sense! It wasn’t even doing a Hercules movie at all! Hercules wasn’t in the movie at all! The characters are weak, the script is **** and it becomes a Gladiator/300 ripoff. Twilight boy ruined the greek story in which I have come to love for years now, f*ck you.
